items.title: JR Automation Plans $72.8M Global HQ
items.summary:
- JR Automation, a Hitachi Group company, will build a 286,000‑sq‑ft global headquarters in Zeeland, Michigan to drive *innovation* and *global collaboration*. 
- Groundbreaking is Sept 17, 2025 with completion by late Fall 2026; the 45‑acre campus houses ~350 employees across 76,000 sq ft of office and 210,000 sq ft of automation assembly, plus sustainability features. 
- The project advances carbon neutrality by 2030 and positions JR Automation as a hub for *digital twin*, *edge computing*, and *AI*-driven manufacturing under the One Hitachi strategy.

items.title: Siemens Training Year 2025: Digital Focus
items.summary:
- Siemens starts the 2025 training year with over 1,700 new trainees at 18 centers, focusing on *digital expertise*, responsible AI and a value compass to prepare Gen Z for the future.
- The program uses *AI‑supported didactics*, VR/AR and immersive methods to teach AI, data analytics, IoT, cybersecurity and the circular economy, promoting lifelong, self-determined learning.
- It strengthens social values with Xplore and digital training agreements via e-signature, plus *SIEYA@School* for STEM career orientation, backed by about €442 million invested in 2024.

items.title: Sappi North America, Valmet Celebrate Successful Start-Up of Rebuilt Paper Machine 2
items.summary: - In May 2025, Sappi North America and *Valmet* celebrated the successful start-up of rebuilt *PM2* at the Somerset facility in Skowhegan, Maine, marking a milestone in Sappi's transition to *packaging grades*.\n- The early production of commercial-grade *SBS board* highlights the strength of the collaboration and progress achieved through close partnership during commissioning.\n- *Valmet*’s technical knowledge and teamwork helped move the project forward, signifying a sustainable conversion and continued ramp-up of PM2.

Yokogawa Launches Green Sustainability Principles

items.title: Otto Mation Comic Caption Contest: September 2025
items.summary:
*Otto is heading to space, prompting readers to create captions for the comic.*
- Submissions can be prize-winning and involve a fun way to engage with automation professionals.
- The article introduces Otto Mation, a comic series about a young automation expert with the rare C.A.P. skill, highlighting his origins and work in the field.

items.title: ABB to Implement Gearless Mill Drive Program in Chile
items.summary:
- *ABB and Codelco* announced a long-term service agreement to optimize maintenance of *gearless mill drive (GMD)* systems at Chilean copper mines.
- The program includes *remote diagnostics*, *lifecycle management*, and support for *sustainability and efficiency* goals across two major mines.
- *GMDs* are crucial for efficient ore processing and reducing emissions, supporting the *growing copper demand* and industry sustainability.

items.title: Honeywell to Optimize AMIGO LNG Facility in Mexico
items.summary:
*Honeywell will implement advanced pretreatment and automation technology at the new AMIGO LNG export terminal in Mexico.*
- *The modular pretreatment system ensures efficient removal of impurities, enabling faster installation and reliable operation.*
- *Integrated control and safety systems will enhance operational control, safety, and project delivery, supporting Mexico's regional energy strategy.*

items.title: Manufacturing Sector Growth Stagnant in Q2 2025
items.summary:
- *Global manufacturing growth remains stagnant* in Q2 2025, affected by *US trade policies* and *uncertainty*. 
- *Regions like Europe* face stagnation, while *growth is concentrated* in China, the US, and select APAC economies. 
- *US tariffs* and *destocking* have slowed *machinery production*, though *growth is expected* to reach about 2% in 2025.

items.title: Brushed DC Motors Lead by Dunkermotoren
items.summary:
- *Brushed DC motors* are valued for their **simplicity, reliability**, and **cost-effectiveness**, powering diverse industries.
- Despite the growth of **brushless** motors, brushed motors like Dunkermotoren's GR Series excel in *high torque*, *wide voltage range*, and *ruggedness*.
- Applications span **medical, automation, transportation, and agriculture**, with a focus on *performance, modularity*, and *long lifespan*.

*Keywords:* brushed motors, Dunkermotoren, industrial automation, reliability, torque, modularity

items.title: Four Maintenance Strategies to Extend Warehouse Equipment Life
items.summary:
*Effective maintenance strategies are crucial for prolonging *warehouse equipment* lifespan, especially in high-throughput environments.*
- Implementing **preventive maintenance** helps catch issues early, reducing costly Downtime.
- Utilizing **predictive maintenance** with IoT and data analytics anticipates failures before they happen, saving costs.
- Keeping **detailed records** and training on-site teams enhances operational efficiency and safety.
**Prioritizing maintenance can boost operational flow, safety, and revenue.**

items.title: Three Big Ultra-Low Voltage Plays by Major Automation Vendors
items.summary:
*Major automation vendors like Siemens, Bosch Rexroth, and Lenze are actively shaping the ULV motor and drive market.*
- Siemens’ acquisition of ebm-papst’s IDT division enhances its ULV offerings, especially for mobile robotics.
- Bosch Rexroth’s Rokit platform offers *flexible, semi-custom solutions* for mobile robotic applications.
- Lenze introduces the o450 MDR to safeguard its presence in the rapidly growing *intralogistics market.*

**The ULV market is characterized by *consolidation, innovation,* and *tailored solutions* to meet diverse industry needs.**

items.title: RealMan Launches Humanoid Robotics Data Training Center
items.summary:
*A new Humanoid Robotics Data Training Center launched in Beijing to accelerate AI and robotics deployment.*
- The 3,000 sqm facility features diverse robots and real-world scenarios, generating over one million data points annually.
- It aims to tackle industry bottlenecks like scenario generalization, simulation gaps, and data standardization to boost commercialization and global adoption.*

items.title: Moxa Wins IRIS Silver Certificate for Railway Projects
items.summary:
*Moxa Inc. received the IRIS Silver Certification*, placing them among the top 12% of companies in the global rail industry for quality and reliability.

- The certification recognizes *Moxa's commitment* to standards like customer satisfaction, project management, and safety in railway solutions.

- With over 15 years of experience, *Moxa offers 500+ products* for railway applications and is actively involved in shaping industry standards and interoperability.

items.title: Twin Transition: Pairing Green and Digital Transitions
items.summary: * The *twin transition* combines green and digital initiatives, aiming to achieve sustainable growth in Europe.* It requires massive investments in AI, IoT, and smart infrastructure.* Real-world cases, like Carlsberg Srbija and the EU’s digital twin projects, demonstrate potential benefits, but challenges include superficial implementation and systemic neglect.*

items.title: Mouser Launches Security Resource Center for Engineers
items.summary:
*Mouser Electronics* has introduced a **Security Resource Center** to help design engineers navigate rising cyber threats. 
- Focuses on challenges like **AI-driven phishing** and **IoT security vulnerabilities**.
- Features products from leading manufacturers (e.g., **STM32N6 microcontrollers**, **Infineon TrustX security board**) and educational resources on *cybersecurity strategies* and *regulatory compliance*.

**This initiative highlights the importance of continuous security education and advanced hardware solutions in protecting digital systems.**

items.title: Valmet Digitalizes Klingele Weener Mill in Germany
items.summary:
- *Valmet* will implement an integrated automation solution to boost *resource efficiency* at Klingele's Weener paper mill.
- The system aims to **reduce surface starch, water, and energy use** by creating a data-driven optimization loop.
- This project reflects **Klingele's commitment** to environmental sustainability and *digital transformation* in paper manufacturing.

items.title: 12 Students Awarded Dematic FIRST Scholarships to Pursue STEM Education
items.summary:
*Dematic awarded scholarships to 12 students supporting STEM education, emphasizing innovation and leadership.*
- The program awarded two $5,000 and ten $1,000 scholarships to students involved in FIRST robotics competitions.
- **Dematic's ongoing commitment** includes sponsorships, mentorship, and investment in future STEM professionals through 2008 to 2025, fostering long-term industry growth.

items.title: Criticality: The Measure That Matters
items.summary:
- Most teams focus on *downtime*, but true *criticality* involves broader factors like safety, cascading failures, and inventory costs.
- Modern *predictive maintenance (PdM)* technologies enable proactive risk management by monitoring asset health and preventing failures.
- To optimize criticality assessment, facilities should expand beyond production impact, incorporating safety, supply chain, and strategic risks for comprehensive reliability management.

items.title: ‘Ask the Right Questions’: Tech Impact on Worker Safety
items.summary:
*Emerging technologies like wearable devices, cobots, AR/VR, and AI have potential safety benefits and risks for workers.*

- *Research highlights evidence gaps and calls for coordinated efforts among researchers, workers, and tech creators.*

- *The report emphasizes the importance of safety science and collaborative evaluation to ensure safe technological adoption.*

items.title: SkillPointe & Schneider Electric Expand Scholarships
items.summary:
*The SkillPointe Foundation and Schneider Electric are expanding a partnership to provide $3,000 scholarships.*
- Schneider Electric commits an additional $100,000 to support education in high-demand fields like energy management and automation.
- This initiative aims to empower aspiring workers, enhance workforce skills, and promote a sustainable future in energy and technology industries.

items.title: Valmet's First Automation Systems in Bangladesh
items.summary:
*Valmet has delivered its first automation systems to Papertech Industries in Bangladesh.*
- This project aims to **enhance production quality and efficiency**, including Bangladesh’s first DCS with a modern user interface.
- The deployment signifies a milestone in *sustainable and resource-efficient* manufacturing for Papertech Industries and showcases Valmet's technological leadership in automation.

items.title: ABB’s Three Years Supporting Saudi Arabia with Locally Made Gas Analyzers
items.summary:

- The 10,000 m² plant specializes in designing, engineering, and manufacturing advanced gas analyzer systems.
- These systems enhance safety, efficiency, and real-time monitoring for petrochemical and natural gas processing operations.**

items.title: Advantech Showcases Nexustec’s TRiMiTi Demo Station
items.summary:
• *Nexustec* launches an advanced AI-driven demo station at Advantech's Innovation Hub to showcase *TRiMiTi*’s capabilities in industrial process control.
• The *software* uses *vision detection* to identify deviations, automatically detect errors, and guide workers, integrating all manufacturing tools for *comprehensive control*.
• The initiative emphasizes *Industry 4.0* transformation with features like *zero defects*, *full traceability*, and seamless integration for both SMEs and large companies.

items.title: ABB and Citroniq Launch 100% Bio-Based Polypropylene Facility
items.summary:
*ABB partners with Citroniq to develop the world’s first full-scale facility producing *biogenic polypropylene* from corn ethanol.*
- The plant in Nebraska will start in 2029, capturing 3 million tonnes of CO₂ annually.
- This innovative project aims to **decarbonize** US polypropylene production and support sustainable plastics manufacturing platform.*

items.title: Space Robotics as a Blueprint for Industrial Automation
items.summary: *Space robotics exemplify *precision*, *resilience*, and *autonomy*, which can revolutionize Earth-based industrial automation.* NASA’s Canadarm2 has operated flawlessly for 24 years in space, demonstrating durability.* Technologies like digital twins, agentic AI, GN&C systems, and sensor fusion can transfer space robotics’ success to manufacturing, enhancing safety, efficiency, and adaptability.*

items.title: Patti Engineering to Share Strategies at MiA 2025
items.summary:
*Sam Hoff, CEO of Patti Engineering, will present at MiA 2025 on upgrading legacy control systems.*
- The seminar, titled "Before you Throw Away, Consider an Upgrade," will cover strategies to modernize controls cost-effectively.
- Topics include using virtual commissioning tools like Siemens Process Sim and maintaining high productivity with system upgrades.

**Key points:**
- Patti Engineering is a Siemens Solution Partner specializing in control system integration.
- The event focuses on advances in automation, AI, data analytics, and digitalization for manufacturing.
- Attendees can explore solutions for energy efficiency, Industry 4.0, and overcoming labor shortages.

items.title: A3 Announces FOCUS Conference Lineup
items.summary:
- *A3* has revealed the program for its inaugural **FOCUS: Intelligent Vision & Industrial AI Conference**, taking place in Seattle on Sept. 24–25, 2025.
- The event features leading speakers from **AWS, Nvidia, Microsoft**, and others, discussing applications of **AI** and **vision tech** across various industries.
- Attendees can explore **hands-on exhibits, real-world case studies**, and participate in a **Humanoid Robot Forum** on Sept. 23 to deepen understanding of advanced automation technologies.

items.title: Lars Granlund Appointed VP at Dacke Industri
items.summary:
*Lars Granlund will become Vice President of Measurement Systems, Electronics at Dacke Industri starting January 2026.*
- Dacke Industri, experiencing recent growth, is streamlining divisions to support future expansion.
- Granlund has extensive leadership experience, notably as CEO of LIMAB AB, a leader in measurement and sensing technologies.*

items.title: How to Select the Best Defect Recognition Software for Your Needs
items.summary:
- *Choosing the right defect recognition software* is critical for ensuring *product quality* and *operational efficiency* in non-destructive testing (NDT).
- Key factors include *compatibility with existing systems*, *accuracy*, *ease of use*, *scalability*, and *vendor support*. 
- Top solutions like **Fujifilm**, **Loopr**, and **Mitutoyo** offer advanced features tailored to various industrial needs, emphasizing the importance of *strategic investment* for long-term benefits.

items.title: Robotics Transforms Cell Therapy
items.summary:
*Multiply Labs developed a robotic biomanufacturing system using Universal Robots, achieving a 74% cost reduction in cell therapies.*

*The robotic process enhances space efficiency, with up to 100x more patient doses per square foot, and improves sterility by reducing contamination.*

*Using 'imitation learning,' robots replicate expert human tasks, ensuring process fidelity and regulatory compliance, promising broader access to personalized gene therapies.*

items.title: Lip-Bu Tan to Receive 2025 Phil Kaufman Award
items.summary:
- *Lip-Bu Tan*, CEO of **Intel** and former CEO of Cadence Design Systems, will be awarded the **2025 Phil Kaufman Award** for contributions to Electronic System Design (ESD).
- The award recognizes his *visionary leadership* in the *semiconductor* industry, fostering innovation, startups, and industry collaboration.
- The ceremony takes place in November 2025 in **San Jose**, with industry leaders honoring his *impact* on technology and design automation.

"Lip-Bu Tan's leadership continues to shape the *future of the semiconductor* and *EDA industries*, promoting *innovation* and *industry growth*."

Arnold Magnetic Technologies' Equipment & Environmental Upgrades

items.title: Enhancing Canal Water Measurement With Automation Solutions
Seven Keys to Overcome Data Silos in Industry
items.summary:
- **Data silos** hinder decision-making in industrial settings due to fragmented OT and IT systems.
- The article identifies **seven critical areas**: data integration, contextualization, quality, scalability, collaboration, cybersecurity, and analytics readiness.
- Implementing open standards, fostering collaboration, and focusing on data quality are essential for **seamless data flow** and unlocking value from operational data.

items.title: Bullen Ultrasonics Gets Patent for Automated Connector
items.summary:
*Bullen Ultrasonics* has received a patent for a *hands-free electrical connector* that enhances *automation* in manufacturing. 
- The *innovative connector* supports *seamless tool changes* and *safety*, especially in high-voltage and abrasive environments. 
- This development boosts *uptime*, reduces *maintenance*, and aligns with *Industry 4.0* goals for *connected, autonomous factories*.

items.title: Industrial AI Reaches Tipping Point: IFS Uncovers ‘The Invisible Revolution’
items.summary:
- **Industrial AI** is undergoing a rapid, global shift, termed the *‘Invisible Revolution’*, embedding AI deeply into business operations.
- Despite impressive ROI, many companies face an *‘AI Execution Gap’*, struggling with staff upskilling and trust issues.
- This transformation is reshaping **business models**, emphasizing automation, predictive maintenance, and outcome-based *servitization*, with those adopting AI fast poised to lead the next industrial era.

items.title: Davi Unveils AI-Vision Plate Measuring System at FABTECH 2025
items.summary:
- *Davi* will debut the **AI-Vision** laser measurement system at **FABTECH 2025**, enhancing plate rolling technology.
- The system uses a **laser blade** and AI algorithms to improve **accuracy, speed**, and reduce **scrap** in the rolling process.
- AI-Vision transmits data directly to CNC machines for **real-time automatic adjustments**, streamlining operations and ensuring precision.

items.title: Tommy Rahbek Nielsen to Lead Winergy
items.summary:
*Tommy Rahbek Nielsen will become President of Flender's Wind Business Segment, effective September 1, 2025.*
- He succeeds Aarnout Kant, who will shift focus to strategic global projects and the Americas.
- Nielsen's extensive wind industry experience, including leadership roles at Vestas, positions him to **expand Winergy's market presence** and reinforce its status as a **leader in wind turbine drive systems**.

items.title: Valmet to Supply Two Papermaking Lines in China
items.summary:
*Valmet will supply two advanced papermaking lines to a Chinese customer, expected to start in late 2026.*
*The lines will produce uncoated woodfree grades with high-speed, modern technology integrated with automation systems.*
*This ongoing collaboration highlights Valmet's strategic presence in China and its reputation for high-quality industrial solutions.*

items.title: Why America Needs More Engineers and Robots
items.summary:
- The U.S. produces significantly fewer *mechanical engineers* (45,000/year) compared to global competitors like China (350,000/year). 
- This *talent shortage* hampers *manufacturing growth* and limits the adoption of *robotics automation*. 
- To strengthen domestic manufacturing, the U.S. must expand *STEM education* and support *small/midsize* companies with scalable automation solutions, combining *human capital* and *technology* for resilience.

items.title: Seeq Appoints Anton Chilton to Board of Directors
items.summary:
- *Anton Chilton* joins Seeq’s Board, bringing over 30 years of *global technology leadership*.
- He previously served as *CEO of QAD Inc.*, guiding its SaaS transformation and strategic growth.
- Chilton aims to support Seeq’s *innovation and digital transformation* efforts in industrial analytics and enterprise software.

items.title: AI’s role in elevating human work at DigiKey
items.summary:
• *AI is transforming industries* by automating repetitive tasks and empowering human expertise. 
• Humans must *remain in control* to provide judgment, empathy, and big-picture understanding AI cannot grasp. 
• DigiKey leverages AI for *security and efficiency*, illustrating how AI enhances human roles rather than replacing them.

items.title: Modernization Key to Prevent OT Cyber Attacks
items.summary:
*Cyberattacks on industrial systems are now a *permanent* threat, causing economic and societal disruptions.*
- Many organizations underestimate vulnerabilities, especially in *unsupported control systems*.
- The article advocates for a *stepwise modernization* approach to strengthen security and reduce attack surfaces, citing examples like ABB's work with ENGIE and risks of shutdown costs, including **billions of dollars per day** for critical infrastructure failures.*

items.title: OnLogic Achieves ISO 27001 Certification
items.summary:
- *OnLogic* has achieved **ISO/IEC 27001:2022** certification, demonstrating a strong commitment to *information security*.
- This certification ensures a **comprehensive ISMS** that protects *confidentiality, integrity*, and *availability* of data, crucial for *mission-critical* industries.
- Achieving this standard reduces risk for customers and supports compliance in *harsh* operational environments, reinforcing trust in OnLogic's solutions for *industrial* applications.

items.title: Control Techniques and Nidec Drive Integration
items.summary:
*Nidec Drives has fully integrated Control Techniques Dynamics (CTD), unifying servo motor and drive offerings.*
- *CTD, founded in 1962, specializes in high-performance brushless servo motors, serving industries like robotics and aerospace.*
- *This move aims to enhance collaboration, optimize operations, and develop innovative servo solutions for global markets.*

items.title: Zion and Geekplus Partner to Expand Robotics
items.summary:
*Zion Solutions Group (ZSG)* announces a strategic partnership with *Geekplus*, a leader in **autonomous mobile robot (AMR)** technology, to enhance warehouse automation across North America.
- ZSG becomes an authorized partner, enabling direct procurement and integration of Geekplus robots, facilitating faster deployment and improved operational efficiency.
- This collaboration aims to make **scalable robotics solutions** more accessible to mid-sized and enterprise businesses, emphasizing flexibility, speed, and performance.

*Keywords: robotics, automation, logistics, warehouse, AMRs, partnership*

items.title: Mitsubishi Electric Iconics Achieves ISO/IEC 27001
items.summary:
*Mitsubishi Electric Iconics Digital Solutions* earned the ISO/IEC 27001:2022 certification, demonstrating a strong commitment to *information security*.
* This achievement highlights their focus on safeguarding customer data, intellectual property, and ensuring system resilience.
* Certification offers *trustworthiness*, *enhanced security*, and aligns with international standards for *risk management* and *security best practices*.

items.title: How Enterprises Can Secure Their Large-Scale 5G IoT Deployments
items.summary:
*5G enables faster, more controllable IoT networks with increased capacity.*
- Larger attack surfaces and decentralized architecture pose new cybersecurity challenges.
- Best practices include encryption, secure authentication, AI threat detection, and evaluating third-party vendors for security compliance.
